alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:16PM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and/or ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following counties, Tippecanoe and Warren. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 PM EST, Broadcast media reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - In addition to flooding along Burnett Creek, reports of Indian Creek being near bankfull and rising have been received. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette, West Lafayette, Shadeland, Battle Ground and Purdue University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
